lead_paragraph: Kansas avoided postseason bans on its football and basketball programs yesterday, but the N.C.A.A. added an extra year to the school’s self-imposed two-year probation and cut additional scholarships. Kansas had placed itself on probation as a result of an investigation into its athletic program by the N.C.A.A. Division I Committee on Infractions.
